newsitem.title: USA: 7th Level says in talks on new strategy.
newsitem.headline: 7th Level says in talks on new strategy.

text.p: 7th Level Inc said Friday it is in discussions with several companies concerning aspects of its new strategy focused on expanding its solutions and technology business.

The company said an immediate goal will be to generate additional capital needed for it to implement its new strategy. It plans to pursue this strategy with a variety of potential ventures and marketing partners.
The company said expanding its solutions and technology business will make it "substantially" less dependent on the "volatile" games market.
It also said it will continue to participate in the game industry with other publishers and producers.
The company said it had no releases in the second quarter, while it released one of its most successful titles, Monty Python & the Quest for the Holy Grail, in 1996 second quarter.
The company said this accounted for its "dramatic difference" in revenues.
7th Level reported a loss of $0.52 per share compared with a loss per share of $0.49 for the same period a year ago. Revenues were $1.0 million versus $5.0 million.
